data.title: Appointments of the Justices
data.meta_description: Information on Supreme Court Justice nominations, appointments by presidential administration, and judicial experience prior to nomination.
data.text:
Visit the Supreme Court Historical Society’s CIVICS website to learn about the history and cases of the Supreme Court of the United States and gain insights into key figures associated with the Court.

A timeline of Supreme Court history, including the Marshall and Warren Courts + landmark cases: West Virginia State Board of Education v. Barnette, and significant rulings in women’s rights court cases.

Note: The nomination dates reflect the lived experience of the justices. They are tied to the date when each justice was informed he or she was nominated, not necessarily the date the president sent the commission to the Senate.
